Based on your preference cues, here are a few movie recommendations:

- "Cold Mountain" (2003): This movie tells the story of two soldiers who return home from World War II. The movie is based on Michael Morpurgo's novel and has been directed by Kevin Reynolds.

- "War Horse" (1982): This movie tells the story of a young boy named Joseph whose horse is called Joey. When World War I breaks out, Joseph's horse Joey becomes an important part of his army unit. The movie is based on Michael Morpurgo's novel and has been directed by Kevin Reynolds.

- "Bloody Sunday" (2002): This movie tells the story of a group of Irish civil rights protesters who are marching through a Catholic neighborhood in Londonderry, Northern Ireland on January 30, 1972. During the march, the British army open fire and kill all of the civil rights protesters. The movie is based on Michael Morpurgo's novel and has been directed by Kevin Reynolds.

- "Gone with the Wind" (1936): This movie tells the story of a sheltered and manipulative Southern belle named Scarlett O'Hara who is married to a wealthy planter named Rhett Butler. When the American Civil War breaks out in 1861, Scarlett O'Hara and Rhett Butler flee their plantation in Georgia and travel to North Carolina, where Scarlett O'Hara plans to stay with her aunt during the war. During her travels, Scarlett O'Hara meets several interesting people who become part of her story.
